tools.name: bookAppointment
tools.description: Schedules a visit. Critical: if the user mentions chest pain, difficulty breathing, or other life-threatening symptoms, do not call this tool. Instead, advise them to call emergency services (911) immediately.

department.description: The medical specialty. Map 'heart' to Cardiology, 'skin/rash' to Dermatology, 'child' to Pediatrics.

priority.description: The urgency of the appointment. Always specify 'Routine' for standard checkups or non-emergency visits unless 'Urgent' is clearly required.

tools.name: checkMedicationInteractions
tools.description: Checks if a new medication conflicts with a user's existing health profile.

tools.name: findDoctorByLocation
tools.description: Finds healthcare providers near the user. Use this if the user asks for a doctor 'near me' or provides a ZIP code.

tools.name: checkLabResults
tools.description: The formal clinical name of the lab test. Crucially, map 'blood sugar' or 'sugar' to 'Glucose', and 'cholesterol' or 'fats' to 'Lipid Panel'.

tools.name: checkInsuranceCoverage
tools.description: The formal medical procedure name only (e.g., 'MRI', 'X-Ray'). Do not include body parts or reasons for the test.

tools.name: requestMedicationRefill
tools.description: Submits a request to the pharmacy for more of an existing prescription.

tools.name: getPrescriptionPrice
tools.description: Checks the price of a drug at different pharmacies. Useful for 'How much is this?' or 'Where is it cheapest?'

tools.name: checkProviderNetwork
tools.description: Checks if a specific doctor or facility is 'In-Network' for the user's insurance plan.
